intro: Quercus ilex var. phillyreoides, commonly known as the Phillyreoides holly oak, is a variant of the evergreen holm oak. It is characterized by its small, leathery, dark green leaves that are typically 2–4 cm in length. The plant produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are enclosed in a dense, hairy cupule. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. This variant is often used in landscaping for its dense foliage and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
